Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: Draw basic plant shapes with little detail (May show a stem and leaves but not much else).
Include some random or unrelated elements (e.g., sun, clouds) without a clear connection to water or plant health.
CANNOT: Accurately differentiate between a watered and unwatered plant (Both plants might look similar with no clear signs of health or wilting).
Depict the presence of water as a necessary pattern for plant growth and health (The student may not show water explicitly or relate it to plant health).
Show a comparison between watered and unwatered plants effectively (May neglect to show differences in plant appearance due to watering).
